trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> for printing a document together with its associated annotations.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator"></xref> class based on a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> and annotation storage <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
By default this constructor sets the text flow direction to <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight>.

If needed you can use one of the alternate <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor overloads to set the text <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection> to a different setting.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.
The document to add the printed annotations to.
The annotation storage stream to retrieve the annotations from.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator"></xref> class based on a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore"></xref>.
By default this constructor sets the text flow direction to <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight>.

If needed you can use one of the alternate <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor overloads to set the text <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection> to a different setting.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.
The document to add the printed annotations to.
The store to retrieve the annotations from.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator"></xref> class based on a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref>, annotation storage <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>, and text <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.
The document to add the printed annotations to.
The annotation storage stream to retrieve the annotations from.
The text flow direction, <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.RightToLeft"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator"></xref> class based on a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore"></xref>, and text <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator> class wraps the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator> specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to add the user annotations to the pages for printing.
The document to add the printed annotations to.
The store to retrieve the annotations from.
The text flow direction, <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.RightToLeft"></xref>.
Cancels all asynchronous operations initiated with a given userState object.
The unique application-defined identifier passed in the call to start the asynchronous operation.

Forces a pagination of the content, updates <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount"></xref> with the new total, and sets <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid"></xref> to `true`.

Immediately after <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.ComputePageCount%2A> returns, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> will be `true` and the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> property will reflect the total number of pages.
The number of pages may change if the annotation content is modified or the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> is changed.

Starts an asynchronous pagination of the content, updates <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount"></xref> with the new total, and sets <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid"></xref> to `true` when it is finished.

The `userState` parameter is intended for use with <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.CancelAsync%2A> method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.
An application-defined object for identifying the asynchronous operation.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage"></xref> together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.
The zero-based page number of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage"></xref> to return.
The for the specified pageNumber; or , if the specified pageNumber does not exist.
Asynchronously returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage"></xref> together with associated user-annotations for a specified page number.

The `userState` parameter is intended for use with <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.CancelAsync%2A> method if the application wishes to cancel the asynchronous operation before completion.
The zero-based page number of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage"></xref> to retrieve.
An application-defined object that is used to identify the asynchronous operation.
Gets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount"></xref> is the total number of pages.

<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> may switch from `true` to `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> recomputed if a change to the content or <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> triggers repagination.

`true` if pagination is complete and <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount"></xref> represents the total number of pages; otherwise, `false` if pagination is in process and <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount"></xref> represents the number of pages currently formatted.
Gets a value that indicates the number of pages currently formatted.

<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid%2A> may change from `true` to `false` and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageCount%2A> recomputed if a change to the content or <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> triggers repagination.

If <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid"></xref> is `true`, the total number of annotation pages; otherwise if <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid"></xref> is `false`, the number of pages currently formatted (pagination in process).
Gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.
<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A> gets or sets the *suggested* size for formatting pages.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Size%2A> property to get the actual size of the page (if it is required the actual size may be cropped from the suggested <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationDocumentPaginator.PageSize%2A>).
The suggested width and height for formatting pages.
Gets the source document that is being paginated.
The source document that is being paginated.
